decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Dragonlord Ojutai as the commander to control the game. The strategy revolves around countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and maintaining card advantage through various draw spells and tutors. The deck also includes a mix of board wipes and targeted removal to handle different types of threats. The inclusion of cards like Helm of Obedience and Jace, the Mind Sculptor allows for alternative win conditions or additional card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and access to the necessary colors for spells. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to outmaneuver opponents through control, card advantage, and strategic play.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and powerful spells. The main win condition is to cast Maelstrom Wanderer and cascading into powerful spells to gain advantage and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes various mana rocks and ramp spells to accelerate the mana production and cast the high-cost spells. Additionally, there are some utility cards like Ral Zarek and Tack Fayden for additional control and card advantage. The mana base is designed to provide a variety of colors for casting spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, ramp up quickly, and finish the game with a powerful cascade from Maelstrom Wanderer.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's ability to tax opponents' spells while ramping up your own mana production. This deck focuses on countering and disrupting opponents' plays with a variety of counterspells like Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile. Additionally, the deck includes card advantage engines like Sphinx's Revelation and Ancestral Vision to help maintain resources. The deck also includes a mix of board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of God to handle threats on the battlefield, and finishers like Sun Titan and Consecrated Sphinx to close out the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize The Mimeoplasm as a commander to recur powerful creatures from the graveyard and generate value through various combos. The deck includes a selection of counter spells and disruption to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. It also has a strong toolbox of cards to search for specific combo pieces or answers to threats. The deck aims to control the game early on with interaction spells and then transition into assembling combo pieces to win the game. It focuses on efficient card selection and manipulation to set up powerful plays and overwhelm opponents with big creatures and game-winning combos.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by counteracting threats and disrupting opponents' strategies while maintaining card advantage through various draw spells. The deck aims to slow down the game with counterspells and removal, eventually overwhelming opponents with powerful control spells like Keranos, God of Storms, and finishers like Wildfire and Jokulhaups. By utilizing a combination of permission spells, card selection, and powerful win conditions, the deck seeks to dominate the tempo of the game and outvalue opponents in the long run. With a strong mana base and a mix of versatile spells, this control deck is well-equipped to handle a variety of threats and emerge victorious in the end.

This aggro deck focuses on using Radha, Heir to Keld as the commander to ramp up mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. The deck includes a mix of aggressive creatures like Inferno Titan, Stormbreath Dragon, and Hero of Oxid Ridge, along with disruptive spells like Blood Moon and Winter Orb to slow down opponents. It also includes powerful equipment like Skullclamp and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance the creatures on the battlefield. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the board with a combination of aggressive threats and resource denial tactics, ultimately aiming to win the game quickly through combat damage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive cards. The deck is built around its commander, Ruhan of the Fomori, who can provide a quick clock while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a variety of versatile spells and cards that can handle different types of threats, such as counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Will, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, and disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Winter Orb. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the control strategy, with a mix of dual lands and mana rocks to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around ramping up quickly with mana dorks and land acceleration spells in order to play powerful threats early on and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck aims to generate a large number of tokens through Titania's ability and cards like Parallel Lives, Avenger of Zendikar, and Hornet Queen, creating a wide board presence that can quickly close out the game. It also includes a variety of utility cards like Sylvan Library, Reclamation Sage, and Crucible of Worlds to handle opposing threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck's goal is to establish a dominant position on the battlefield and maintain pressure throughout the game.
